00004 /*!  \file  octeon_droq.h
00005      \brief Host Driver: Implemantation of Octeon Output queues.
00006 */
00007 
00008 #ifndef __OCTEON_DROQ_H__
00009 #define __OCTEON_DROQ_H__
00010 
00011 
00012 
00013 #include "octeon_main.h"
00014 
00015 /**     DROQ Implementation.  */
00016 
00017 //#define USE_DROQ_THREADS
00018 
00019 
00020 
00021 
00022 
00023 /** Octeon descriptor format.
00024     The descriptor ring is made of descriptors which have 2 64-bit values:
00025     -# Physical (bus) address of the data buffer.
00026     -# Physical (bus) address of a octeon_droq_info_t structure.
00027     The Octeon device DMA's incoming packets and its information at the address
00028     given by these descriptor fields.
00029  */
00030 typedef struct  {
00031 
00032   /** The buffer pointer */
00033    uint64_t        buffer_ptr;
00034 
00035   /** The Info pointer */
00036    uint64_t        info_ptr;
00037 
00038 }octeon_droq_desc_t;
00039 
00040 #define OCT_DROQ_DESC_SIZE    (sizeof(octeon_droq_desc_t))
00041 
00042 
00043 
00044 /** Information about packet DMA'ed by Octeon.
00045     The format of the information available at Info Pointer after Octeon 
00046     has posted a packet. Not all descriptors have valid information. Only
00047     the Info field of the first descriptor for a packet has information
00048     about the packet. */
00049 typedef struct {
00050 
00051   /** The Output Response Header. */
00052    octeon_resp_hdr_t    resp_hdr;
00053 
00054   /** The Length of the packet. */
00055    uint64_t             length;
00056 
00057 }octeon_droq_info_t;
00058 
00059 #define OCT_DROQ_INFO_SIZE   (sizeof(octeon_droq_info_t))
00060 
00061 
00062 
00063 
00064 /** Pointer to data buffer.
00065     Driver keeps a pointer to the data buffer that it made available to 
00066     the Octeon device. Since the descriptor ring keeps physical (bus)
00067     addresses, this field is required for the driver to keep track of
00068     the virtual address pointers. The fields are operated by
00069     OS-dependent routines.
00070 */
00071 typedef struct  {
00072 
00073   /** Pointer to the packet buffer. Hidden by void * to make it OS independent.
00074          */
00075      void        *buffer;
00076 
00077   /** Pointer to the data in the packet buffer.
00078       This could be different or same as the buffer pointer depending
00079       on the OS for which the code is compiled. */
00080      uint8_t        *data;
00081 
00082 } octeon_recv_buffer_t;
00083 
00084 #define OCT_DROQ_RECVBUF_SIZE    (sizeof(octeon_recv_buffer_t))
00085 
00086 
00087 
00088 
00089 /** The Descriptor Ring Output Queue structure.
00090     This structure has all the information required to implement a 
00091     Octeon DROQ.
00092 */
00093 typedef struct  {
00094 
00095   /** A spinlock to protect access to this ring. */
00096    cavium_spinlock_t        lock;
00097 
00098    uint32_t                 q_no;
00099 
00100    uint32_t                 fastpath_on;
00101 
00102    octeon_droq_ops_t        ops;
00103 
00104    octeon_device_t         *oct_dev;
00105 
00106 #ifdef  USE_DROQ_THREADS
00107 
00108    cvm_kthread_t            thread;
00109 
00110    cavium_wait_channel      wc;
00111 
00112    int                      stop_thread;
00113 
00114    cavium_atomic_t          thread_active;
00115 
00116 #endif
00117 
00118   /** The 8B aligned descriptor ring starts at this address. */
00119    octeon_droq_desc_t      *desc_ring;
00120 
00121   /** Index in the ring where the driver should read the next packet */
00122    uint32_t                 host_read_index;
00123 
00124   /** Index in the ring where Octeon will write the next packet */
00125    uint32_t                 octeon_write_index;
00126 
00127   /** Index in the ring where the driver will refill the descriptor's buffer */
00128    uint32_t                 host_refill_index;
00129 
00130   /** Packets pending to be processed - tasklet implementation */
00131    cavium_atomic_t          pkts_pending;
00132 
00133   /** Number of  descriptors in this ring. */
00134    uint32_t                 max_count;
00135 
00136   /** The number of descriptors pending refill. */
00137    uint32_t                 refill_count;
00138 
00139    uint32_t                 pkts_per_intr;
00140    uint32_t                 refill_threshold;
00141 
00142   /** The max number of descriptors in DROQ without a buffer.
00143       This field is used to keep track of empty space threshold. If the
00144       refill_count reaches this value, the DROQ cannot accept a max-sized
00145       (64K) packet. */
00146    uint32_t                 max_empty_descs;
00147 
00148    /** The 8B aligned info ptrs begin from this address. */
00149    octeon_droq_info_t      *info_list;
00150 
00151   /** The receive buffer list. This list has the virtual addresses of the
00152       buffers.  */
00153    octeon_recv_buffer_t    *recv_buf_list;
00154 
00155   /** The size of each buffer pointed by the buffer pointer. */
00156    uint32_t                 buffer_size;
00157 
00158   /** Pointer to the mapped packet credit register.
00159        Host writes number of info/buffer ptrs available to this register */
00160    void                    *pkts_credit_reg;
00161 
00162   /** Pointer to the mapped packet sent register.
00163       Octeon writes the number of packets DMA'ed to host memory
00164       in this register. */
00165    void                    *pkts_sent_reg;
00166 
00167 #if  defined(ENABLE_PCIE_2G4G_FIX)
00168    void                    *buffer_block;
00169 #endif
00170 
00171    cavium_list_t            dispatch_list;
00172 
00173   /** Statistics for this DROQ. */
00174    oct_droq_stats_t         stats;
00175 
00176   /** DMA mapped address of the DROQ descriptor ring. */
00177    unsigned long            desc_ring_dma;
00178 
00179   /** Info ptr list are allocated at this virtual address. */
00180    unsigned long            info_base_addr;
00181 
00182   /** Allocated size of info list. */
00183    uint32_t                 info_alloc_size;
00184 
00185 }octeon_droq_t;
00186 
00187 
00188 #define OCT_DROQ_SIZE   (sizeof(octeon_droq_t))
00189 
00190 
00191 /**
00192  *  Allocates space for the descriptor ring for the droq and sets the
00193  *   base addr, num desc etc in Octeon registers.
00194  *
00195  * @param  oct_dev    - pointer to the octeon device structure
00196  * @param  droq_conf  - pointer to the configuration values for this droq 
00197  * @param  q_no       - droq no. ranges from 0 - 3.
00198  * @return Success: 0    Failure: 1
00199 */
00200 int   octeon_init_droq(octeon_device_t       *oct_dev,
00201                        uint32_t                 q_no);
00202 
00203 /**
00204  *  Frees the space for descriptor ring for the droq.
00205  *
00206  *  @param oct_dev - pointer to the octeon device structure
00207  *  @param q_no    - droq no. ranges from 0 - 3.
00208  *  @return:    Success: 0    Failure: 1
00209 */
00210 int   octeon_delete_droq(octeon_device_t   *oct_dev,
00211                          uint32_t             q_no);

00220 wait_for_oq_pkts(octeon_device_t  *oct);
